observations: CRITICAL: The documented UI location 'Admin > Site Settings > Migration Tool' does NOT exist. No Migration Tool option is present in the Settings menu.
Code review reveals Content Layout Migration is an AUTOMATIC UPGRADE PROCESS, not a manual admin tool. It is triggered via BusinessController.UpgradeModule('08.02.00') during platform upgrades.
The ContentLayouts database table EXISTS (IsMigrationApplicable() returns true), but contains NO DATA - indicating either all legacy layouts were already migrated, or none existed.

Migration logic in ContentLayoutMigrationController.cs: 1) Gets unmigrated layouts from ContentLayouts table, 2) Groups by TabId, 3) Temporarily disables tab versioning/workflow, 4) Creates new module instances, 5) Updates pane names, 6) Re-enables versioning/workflow, 7) Marks layouts as migrated.
The migration process properly preserves module permissions via ModuleController.InitialModulePermission() and handles tab version details.
Since no UI exists and no legacy data is present, none of the suggested test scenarios can be executed via UI interaction.
